description: Automotive Claims Assessment Policies - Guidelines for evaluating automotive insurance claims including damage assessment, liability determination, fraud detection, and payout calculation

policies.name: Damage Severity Classification
policies.description: Guidelines for classifying vehicle damage severity based on visual assessment and repair estimates

criteria.condition: Single minor dent OR scratch < 6 inches AND no structural damage AND no component replacement needed
criteria.action: Standard processing, estimated repair $0-$1,000. Fast-track approval eligible.
criteria.rationale: Cosmetic damage only with no safety implications. Typically PDR (paintless dent repair) or touch-up.

criteria.condition: Multiple dents OR panel damage OR single component replacement (bumper, light, mirror) AND no structural damage
criteria.action: Standard processing, estimated repair $1,000-$5,000. Photo documentation required.
criteria.rationale: Repairable damage affecting single panel or requiring component replacement. No frame involvement.

criteria.condition: Multiple panel damage OR airbag deployment OR suspension/alignment affected OR structural component affected
criteria.action: Senior adjuster review required, estimated repair $5,000-$15,000. Frame inspection mandatory.
criteria.rationale: Significant damage requiring frame assessment and possible structural repair. Safety systems may be compromised.

criteria.condition: Repair cost exceeds 70% of vehicle value OR frame damage beyond repair OR safety systems compromised beyond repair
criteria.action: Total loss evaluation required. Obtain market value assessment (NADA, KBB). Salvage value determination.
criteria.rationale: Economically unviable to repair. Proceed with total loss settlement per policy terms.

modifying_factors.impact: Vehicles > 10 years old OR > 150K miles: lower threshold for total loss (60% of value instead of 70%)
Documented pre-existing damage reduces payout by appraised diminution. Require photos of prior condition if available.
OEM parts add 10-25% to estimate. Use aftermarket if permitted by policy and state law.
Agreed value policies apply. Specialty appraiser may be required.

policies.name: Damage Location Assessment
policies.description: Guidelines for evaluating damage by vehicle location and associated repair complexity

criteria.condition: Front-end damage (bumper, grille, hood, headlights) with no radiator or engine involvement
criteria.action: Standard repair estimate. Check for hidden damage to radiator support and cooling system.
criteria.rationale: Front-end cosmetic damage is common and straightforward. Hidden damage check required.

criteria.condition: Front-end damage with radiator, AC condenser, or engine compartment involvement
criteria.action: Mechanical inspection required. Fluid leak assessment. Supplement likely.
criteria.rationale: Mechanical components affected increase complexity and cost significantly.

criteria.condition: Side impact damage to doors and quarter panels with no B-pillar or rocker involvement
criteria.action: Door replacement or repair. Check for intrusion bar integrity.
criteria.rationale: Side panel replacement is standard but intrusion bars must be inspected for safety.

criteria.condition: Side impact with B-pillar, rocker panel, or floor pan damage
criteria.action: Structural repair required. Frame measurement mandatory. Senior review.
criteria.rationale: Structural side damage affects vehicle safety envelope and requires specialized repair.

criteria.condition: Rear-end damage to bumper, trunk/tailgate, tail lights only
criteria.action: Standard repair. Check rear body panel alignment.
criteria.rationale: Rear cosmetic damage typically straightforward with good parts availability.

criteria.condition: Rear-end damage affecting rear floor, fuel system, or rear suspension
criteria.action: Fuel system inspection mandatory. Frame measurement required. Supplement expected.
criteria.rationale: Rear structural damage may affect fuel system safety and suspension geometry.

criteria.condition: Roof or rollover damage
criteria.action: Total loss evaluation likely. Structural integrity compromised. Safety systems (airbags, curtains) affected.
criteria.rationale: Roof damage typically indicates severe impact. Structural integrity cannot be guaranteed after rollover.

modifying_factors.impact: Body-on-frame vehicles (trucks, SUVs) may have frame straightening option. Unibody damage is often more severe.
Specialty materials require certified repair facilities. Add 25-50% to labor estimates.

policies.name: Liability Assessment
policies.description: Guidelines for determining fault and liability percentage based on incident circumstances

criteria.condition: Rear-end collision with no contributing factors from lead vehicle (no sudden stop, brake check, reverse)
criteria.action: Clear liability. Expedited processing. No comparative negligence applies.
criteria.rationale: Following vehicle is responsible for maintaining safe following distance under all conditions.

criteria.condition: Rear-end collision with evidence of brake check, sudden reverse, or aggressive driving by lead vehicle
criteria.action: Review dashcam evidence. Obtain witness statements. Apply comparative negligence.
criteria.rationale: Intentional or reckless actions by lead vehicle may shift partial liability.

criteria.condition: Intersection collision with traffic signal present AND clear red light runner
criteria.action: Obtain police report. Review traffic camera footage if available. Clear liability.
criteria.rationale: Traffic control violations establish clear fault.

criteria.condition: Intersection collision with disputed signal status
criteria.action: Request traffic camera footage. Obtain all witness statements. Review dashcam from both parties.
criteria.rationale: Word vs word scenarios require independent evidence to establish fault.

criteria.condition: Left turn collision with through traffic
criteria.liability_determination: Left turning vehicle typically 100% at fault
criteria.action: Document right of way. Through traffic has priority unless turning vehicle had green arrow.
criteria.rationale: Left turning vehicle must yield to oncoming traffic unless protected by signal.

criteria.condition: Parking lot collision - one vehicle parked, one vehicle moving
criteria.action: Clear liability. Parked vehicle has no contributory negligence.
criteria.rationale: Moving vehicle has duty to avoid stationary objects.

criteria.condition: Parking lot collision - both vehicles moving (backing, lane travel)
criteria.liability_determination: Comparative: Typically 50/50 unless evidence shows one party clearly at fault
criteria.action: Review damage patterns. Backing vehicle often majority at fault. Check for right of way.
criteria.rationale: Parking lot collisions with both vehicles moving require detailed damage analysis.

criteria.condition: Multi-vehicle collision (3+ vehicles) - chain reaction
criteria.liability_determination: Initial striking vehicle typically at fault for all impacts
criteria.action: Detailed investigation required. Diagram all impacts. May involve multiple at-fault parties.
criteria.rationale: Chain reactions may have shared liability if intermediate vehicles failed to maintain distance.

criteria.condition: Single vehicle accident - road hazard, animal, weather
criteria.liability_determination: Comprehensive claim - no third party liability
criteria.action: Verify coverage type (collision vs comprehensive). Document road/weather conditions.
criteria.rationale: No third party at fault. Coverage depends on policy terms.

modifying_factors.impact: Pure comparative vs modified comparative (50% or 51% bar) affects recovery. Check state law.
Police citation strengthens but does not conclusively establish civil liability.
Dashcam or surveillance video may override eyewitness accounts. Preserve all video evidence.

policies.name: Fraud Indicator Detection
policies.description: Guidelines for identifying potential fraudulent automotive insurance claims

criteria.condition: Claim filed within 30 days of policy inception or coverage increase
criteria.action: SIU referral. Enhanced documentation review. Verify policy application accuracy.
criteria.rationale: New policies have significantly higher fraud incidence. Pre-existing damage often claimed on new policies.

criteria.condition: Repair estimate exceeds visible damage assessment by more than 50%
criteria.action: Independent appraisal required. Request supplement justification. Review repair facility history.
criteria.rationale: Estimate inflation is a common fraud pattern. Legitimate hidden damage should be documented with photos.

criteria.condition: Multiple claims in 12-month period (more than 2 at-fault claims)
criteria.action: Claims history pattern analysis. Review for consistency. Consider EUO (Examination Under Oath).
criteria.rationale: Frequent claims may indicate fraud, claim abuse, or high-risk behavior.

criteria.condition: Damage pattern inconsistent with described incident mechanism
criteria.action: SIU referral. Accident reconstruction may be required. Photo analysis. Possible EUO.
criteria.rationale: Staged accidents often have damage patterns that don't match the claimed incident narrative.

criteria.condition: No police report for significant damage claim (>$5,000) without reasonable explanation
criteria.action: Request written explanation. Verify claimed incident details independently.
criteria.rationale: Legitimate significant accidents typically have police documentation. Exception for remote locations.

criteria.condition: Claimant insisting on specific repair facility known for fraud or overbilling
criteria.action: Offer alternative facility options. Request competitive estimates. Enhanced estimate review.
criteria.rationale: Collusion between claimant and repair facility is a common fraud scheme.

criteria.condition: Prior damage visible in photos that appears unrelated to claimed incident
criteria.action: Document prior damage. Request pre-loss photos from claimant. Adjust estimate to exclude prior damage.
criteria.rationale: Claimants may attempt to include pre-existing damage in current claim.

criteria.condition: Vehicle ownership recently transferred before claim
criteria.action: Verify ownership chain. Check for liens. Confirm insurable interest at time of loss.
criteria.rationale: Title washing and owner-give-up schemes involve recent ownership transfers.

criteria.condition: Claimant uncooperative with investigation or documentation requests
criteria.action: Document all requests and responses. Issue formal demand letters. Consider claim denial for non-cooperation.
criteria.rationale: Legitimate claimants typically cooperate with reasonable investigation requests.

modifying_factors.impact: Claims from known high-fraud ZIP codes warrant enhanced scrutiny.
Claimants with insurance or repair industry knowledge may be more sophisticated.
Late night incidents with no witnesses warrant additional verification.

policies.name: Repair Estimate Validation
policies.description: Guidelines for validating and adjusting repair estimates to ensure fair and accurate payout

criteria.condition: Estimate within 10% of AI damage assessment and market benchmarks
criteria.action: Approve estimate as submitted. No adjustment required.
criteria.rationale: Estimate aligns with damage severity and market rates. Standard approval process.

criteria.condition: Estimate exceeds AI assessment by 10-25%
criteria.action: Review line items for reasonableness. Request photo documentation for any hidden damage claimed.
criteria.rationale: Minor discrepancy may indicate legitimate hidden damage. Documentation required.

criteria.condition: Estimate exceeds AI assessment by more than 25%
criteria.action: Independent appraisal required. Negotiate or deny excess amount. Document all disputed items.
criteria.rationale: Significant discrepancy requires third-party verification. May indicate overbilling.

criteria.condition: Labor rate exceeds prevailing market rate by more than 15%
criteria.action: Adjust to prevailing market rate for region. Provide rate documentation to claimant.
criteria.rationale: Insurance pays reasonable and customary rates. Excessive labor rates not covered.

criteria.condition: Parts pricing exceeds OEM list or reasonable aftermarket rates
criteria.action: Verify parts sourcing. Apply policy terms for OEM vs aftermarket. Adjust for betterment if applicable.
criteria.rationale: Parts should be priced at list or competitive aftermarket rates per policy terms.

criteria.condition: Betterment applies (new parts on worn vehicle)
criteria.action: Calculate betterment deduction based on age and condition of replaced components.
criteria.rationale: Claimant should not profit from claim. Betterment applies to tires, batteries, wear items.

modifying_factors.impact: Use Mitchell, CCC, or Audatex prevailing rates for specific ZIP code.
Luxury and exotic vehicles may justify higher labor rates at certified facilities.
Rare or backordered parts may justify rental car extension or storage fees.

policies.name: Total Loss Settlement Calculation
policies.description: Guidelines for calculating fair market value and settlement for total loss vehicles

criteria.condition: Vehicle declared total loss with clear title and no liens
criteria.action: Obtain ACV from NADA, KBB, and comparable sales. Offer settlement at fair market value minus deductible.
criteria.rationale: Standard total loss settlement process for unencumbered vehicles.

criteria.condition: Vehicle declared total loss with active lien
criteria.action: Obtain payoff from lienholder. Settlement paid to lienholder first, remainder to insured.
criteria.rationale: Lienholder interest must be satisfied before insured receives funds.

criteria.condition: Owner retention of total loss vehicle
criteria.action: Deduct salvage value from settlement. Owner keeps vehicle. Brand title as salvage per state law.
criteria.rationale: Insured may elect to keep vehicle and receive reduced settlement.

criteria.condition: Gap insurance claim triggered
criteria.action: Calculate gap between ACV and loan balance. Process gap claim with gap insurer.
criteria.rationale: Gap coverage pays difference between ACV and outstanding loan if applicable.

modifying_factors.impact: Adjust ACV for mileage, condition, and installed options vs base model.
Use comparable sales within 100-mile radius for accurate local market value.
Document and add value for recent repairs or improvements (new tires, brakes) if receipts provided.
